options.caption: Detection of studies contributing excessively to heterogeneity. The x-axis represents the heterogeneity measured by Cochran's Q, while the y-axis represents the influence value determined through the leave-one-out method, expressed as a standardized difference of overall effect with and without the study.
options.label: baujat

options.caption: Comparison of influence measures by study. The dashed line represents the pooled effect, while the bars indicate the different influence measures for each study. These measures help to characterize which studies fit well into our meta-analysis model.
options.label: influences-diagnostics
